content.question: Assuming the marginal propensity to consume is less than 1, which of the following describes why the magnitude of the tax multiplier is smaller than the magnitude of the expenditure multiplier?

choices.label: Changes in income taxes initially affect both household consumption and household savings.
Changes in income taxes initially affect household savings only.
Changes in income taxes initially affect net investment instead of consumption.
Changes in income taxes initially affect exports only.
Changes in income taxes initially affect firms only.

content.answer: Changes in income taxes initially affect both household consumption and household savings.
